page.title: 13EVENTS-SCHOOL EISTEDDFOD
page.content: On March lst, our school holds an annual event called an Eisteddfod. This is a Welsh custom and is held to celebrate St. David's Day. St. David is the patron saint of Wales. All the girls wear special costumes of long black and white check skirts, white blouses, tall black hats and a check shawl. We wear a leaf of daffodil on March lst as they are our national emblems. In our school eisteddfod children compete against each other for points for their house. This year, l985, Gwent won the shield for the house gaining most points. Competitions were held in music, art, craft, knitting, handwriting, poetry and story writing. A cookery competition is judged after which the cakes are sold and this year the money received was donated to the Mayor's charity.
